Apply Now        Request Information        Events                                                              The 42-credit M.S. in Management and Systems degree combines rigorous coursework with industry case studies to help you to explore critical, current issues and trends, as well as factors and developments that will affect the industry well into the future. The program’s focus on connecting technology with business strategy is a unique approach that allows you to learn to analyze the organization as one dynamic system—giving you a major competitive advantage in an increasingly technological business world. Every course, no matter how specialized, has business strategy woven into its content.   With the option to take courses online, on-site, or through a combination of these formats, you can concentrate in one of four areas: database technologies; systems management; strategy and leadership; or enterprise risk management. And with courses offered during evenings and on weekends, the M.S. in Management and Systems can be pursued full- or part-time, allowing maximum flexibility for the schedule requirements of both the busy senior manager or executive, as well as the recent college graduate just beginning a career. The program can be completed in two years of full-time study, or in up to five years of part-time study.   Working with a faculty advisor, you map out your own program of study that includes seven core courses and four courses in one of four concentration options. You also choose an elective from any of the courses offered in the program, including a broad array of special topics courses. The capstone project gives you the opportunity to demonstrate your newly acquired skills by developing a comprehensive research or applied project that makes an original contribution to the body of knowledge in the field. The mission of the NYU Department of Global Security and Crisis Management is to create, promote and preserve a safe and secure University environment by delivering high quality community safety and protection services in a professional and customer friendly manner. The department is committed to the professional growth of its security staff and the continual development of its relationship with the University and external communities.   The Vision of the department is to achieve the highest level of safety and security for the NYU community and, in so doing, establish the Public Safety Department as a leader in the campus security industry. In striving for excellence in the areas of personnel development, strategic security planning, advanced security technology and customer service, we will fulfill this vision.                                                           Campus Safety                                                                                         NYU Card Services                                                                                         Campus Bus Routes                                                                                         Policies and Reports                                         The department maintains a state of readiness that enables it to respond quickly and effectively to security challenges. Advanced development of personnel, the use of tested state-of-the-art electronic equipment, and an integrated, reliable and safe transportation system are components that drive our state of readiness. Creating and maintaining a strong partnership with the university community combined with federal, state and local governmental authorities play an integral role in elevating our state of readiness and in achieving our vision.        Goals      To identify and maintain access control devices that maximizes effective screening of those seeking to enter university facilities.    To effectively deploy personnel and resources that would maximize visibility and minimize response time for calls for service.    To investigate all reported crimes and department misconduct in a timely and thorough manner.    To promote a sustained crime prevention program in partnership with the university community and local law enforcement authorities.    To maintain an efficient, safe and dependable campus transportation system.             Values     Protect the lives and property of the student, faculty, staff and visitors to the University.   Reduce the risk of harm to the student, faculty, staff and visitors to the University by carefully deploying personnel and resources.   Maintain a higher standard of integrity than is generally expected of the general university community.   Respect the dignity of each individual by rendering our security service with professionalism, respect, integrity, dedication and empathy.
